title: Starship Completes Sixth Flight Test, Marks Progress Toward Full Reusability
summary: Starship Completes Sixth Flight Test, Marks Progress Toward Full Reusability

title: No Catch This Time, But IFT-6 Advances Starship Development
summary: SpaceX’s sixth Starship Integrated Flight Test, IFT-6, may not have thrilled everyone with another spectacular booster catch, but the hour-long mission demonstrated advancements in the vehicle’s performance that pushes it...

title: Launch Roundup: Falcon 9 launches continue, Rocket Lab to launch two Electrons, Russia to fly to ISS
summary: Following the sixth flight of SpaceX’s Starship on Tuesday, four additional orbital launches are planned worldwide. Rocket Lab will launch an experimental hypersonic testbed payload using a modified Electron from Wallops. What’s more, a second Electron will launch a batch of nanosatellites into low-Earth orbit from New Zealand.

title: Super Heavy-Starship launches on sixth test flight, skips tower catch
summary: With President-elect Donald Trump and newly-minted efficiency czar Elon Musk looking on, SpaceX launched the world's most powerful rocket on its sixth test flight Tuesday, an up-and-down trip to space by a gargantuan Super Heavy-Starship to evaluate a variety of safety and performance upgrades.

title: SpaceX launches sixth Starship but aborts booster landing
summary: SpaceX launched its Starship vehicle on its sixth test flight Nov. 19 but called off a planned landing of the Super Heavy booster back at the launch site.

title: Kepler goes all in on optical communications
summary: Kepler Communications is seeking permission to operate larger but significantly fewer satellites for its proposed data relay constellation, which would now use lasers instead of radio frequencies to connect low Earth orbit customers.

title: U.S. military constellation advances despite supply chain hurdles
summary: The first launch of Tranche 1 of the Proliferated Warfighter Space Architecture (PWSA), originally scheduled for September 2024, is now anticipated in the March to April 2025 timeframe

title: Europe’s IRIS² constellation faces challenges of timing, scaling and competition
summary: BREMEN, Germany — Europe’s plan to launch a sovereign satellite communication constellation is moving ahead once more, but IRIS² faces challenges of timing, scale and feasibility in the face of […]

title: SpaceX successfully launches sixth Starship test flight with no catch
summary: SpaceX successfully launched its sixth test flight of Starship on Tuesday from Starbase, Texas. There was no catch today, as SpaceX did...

title: From Houston to the Moon: Johnson’s Thermal Vacuum Chamber Tests Lunar Solar Technology
summary: Imagine designing technology that can survive on the Moon for up to a decade, providing a continuous energy supply. NASA selected three companies to develop such systems, aimed at providing a power source at the Moon’s South Pole for Artemis missions.  Three companies were awarded contracts in 2022 with plans to test their self-sustaining solar […]
